message.content:
cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CC

The paper discusses the role of connectionism in cognitive modeling, which is a topic commonly studied in the subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also proposes a solution to the symbol grounding problem, which involves the use of categorical representations and connectionism, both of which are topics studied in the subfields of neural networks (cs.NE) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of symbolic representations, which is a topic studied in the subfield of natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper touches on the idea of a hybrid nonsymbolic/symbolic model of the mind, which could fall under the subfield of computational cognition (cs.CC).
